columns.Description: Date and time when the record was generated
columns.Name: Timestamp

columns.Description: Unique identifier for the email, generated by Office 365
columns.Name: NetworkMessageId

columns.Description: Public-facing identifier for the email that is set by the sending email system
columns.Name: InternetMessageId

columns.Description: Sender email address in the MAIL FROM header, also known as the envelope sender or the Return-Path address
columns.Name: SenderMailFromAddress

columns.Description: Sender email address in the FROM header, which is visible to email recipients on their email clients
columns.Name: SenderFromAddress

columns.Description: Name of the sender displayed in the address book, typically a combination of a given or first name, a middle initial, and a last name or surname
columns.Name: SenderDisplayName

columns.Description: Unique identifier for the sender’s account in Microsoft Entra ID
columns.Name: SenderObjectId

columns.Description: Sender domain in the MAIL FROM header, also known as the envelope sender or the Return-Path address
columns.Name: SenderMailFromDomain

columns.Description: Sender domain in the FROM header, which is visible to email recipients on their email clients
columns.Name: SenderFromDomain

columns.Description: IPv4 address of the last detected mail server that relayed the message
columns.Name: SenderIPv4

columns.Description: IPv6 address of the last detected mail server that relayed the message
columns.Name: SenderIPv6

columns.Description: Email address of the recipient, or email address of the recipient after distribution list expansion
columns.Name: RecipientEmailAddress

columns.Description: Unique identifier for the email recipient in Microsoft Entra ID
columns.Name: RecipientObjectId

columns.Description: Subject of the email
columns.Name: Subject

columns.Description: Identifier for the group of similar emails clustered based on heuristic analysis of their contents
columns.Name: EmailClusterId

columns.Description: Direction of the email relative to your network:  Inbound, Outbound, Intra-org
columns.Name: EmailDirection

columns.Description: Delivery action of the email: Delivered, Junked, Blocked, or Replaced
columns.Name: DeliveryAction

columns.Description: Location where the email was delivered: Inbox/Folder, On-premises/External, Junk, Quarantine, Failed, Dropped, Deleted items
columns.Name: DeliveryLocation

columns.Description: Verdict from the email filtering stack on whether the email contains malware, phishing, or other threats
columns.Name: ThreatTypes

columns.Description: Detection name for malware or other threats found
columns.Name: ThreatNames

columns.Description: Methods used to detect malware, phishing, or other threats found in the email
columns.Name: DetectionMethods

columns.Description: List of confidence levels of any spam or phishing verdicts. For spam, this column shows the spam confidence level (SCL), indicating if the email was skipped (-1), found to be not spam (0,1), found to be spam with moderate confidence (5,6), or found to be spam with high confidence (9). For phishing, this column displays whether the confidence level is "High" or "Low".
columns.Name: ConfidenceLevel

columns.Description: Threshold assigned to email from bulk mailers, a high bulk complain level (BCL) means the email is more likely to generate complaints, and thus more likely to be spam
columns.Name: BulkComplaintLevel

columns.Description: Final action taken on the email based on filter verdict, policies, and user actions:  Move message to junk mail folder, Add X-header, Modify subject, Redirect message, Delete message, send to quarantine, No action taken, Bcc message
columns.Name: EmailAction

columns.Description: Action policy that took effect: Antispam high-confidence, Antispam, Antispam bulk mail, Antispam phishing, Anti-phishing domain impersonation, Anti-phishing user impersonation, Anti-phishing spoof, Anti-phishing graph impersonation, Antimalware Safe Attachments, Enterprise Transport Rules (ETR)
columns.Name: EmailActionPolicy

columns.Description: Unique identifier for the policy that determined the final mail action
columns.Name: EmailActionPolicyGuid

columns.Description: List of pass or fail verdicts by email authentication protocols like DMARC, DKIM, SPF or a combination of multiple authentication types (CompAuth)
columns.Name: AuthenticationDetails

columns.Description: Number of attachments in the email
columns.Name: AttachmentCount

columns.Description: Number of embedded URLs in the email
columns.Name: UrlCount

columns.Description: Detected language of the email content
columns.Name: EmailLanguage

columns.Description: Custom instructions that define organizational mail flow and how the email was routed
columns.Name: Connectors

columns.Description: Action taken on the email in response to matches to a policy defined at the organizational level
columns.Name: OrgLevelAction

columns.Description: Organizational policy that triggered the action taken on the email
columns.Name: OrgLevelPolicy

columns.Description: Action taken on the email in response to matches to a mailbox policy defined by the recipient
columns.Name: UserLevelAction

columns.Description: End user mailbox policy that triggered the action taken on the email
columns.Name: UserLevelPolicy

columns.Description: Unique identifier for the event
columns.Name: ReportId

columns.Description: Additional information about the entity or event
columns.Name: AdditionalFields

columns.Description: Last known location of the email.
columns.Name: LatestDeliveryLocation

columns.Description: Last known action attempted on an email by the service or by an admin through manual remediation.
columns.Name: LatestDeliveryAction

columns.Description: Mail flow rules (also known as transport rules) are similar to Inbox rules that are available in Outlook and Outlook on the web. The main difference is mail flow rules take action on messages while they're in transit.
columns.Name: ExchangeTransportRule

columns.Description: Name of distribution list that the recipient was a member of and to which the email was sent, if applicable; shows top-level distribution list if nested lists are involved
columns.Name: DistributionList

columns.Description: A JSON array of forwarding details including the forwarding user and the forwarding type
columns.Name: ForwardingInformation
